scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Six files and one paper-wrapped parcel of records documenting the work of the Confederated Spanish Societies (Sociedades Hispanas Confederadas), an organization founded (apparently in New York) in 1936 to organize support for the Republican cause. Among its Sponsors were such prominent figures as Albert Einstein, Pablo Casals, Albert Camus, Nancy and Dwight Macdonald, A. Philip Randolph, Ignazio Silone and Victor Reuther. The files include correspondence relating to the Societies' publication, Espana Libre, proceedings and minutes of meetings, publicity materials directed at the American public, correspondence directed to United Nations, U.S. and Spanish officials regarding the treatment of Republican prisoners in Spain and other issues, and correspondence from sympathizers. A majority of the documents are in Spanish.
